readability_reflection:
String concatenation was more readable to me because there is better spacing to tell that I'm adding something. For example, I personally find that
"http://" + domain + "/" page + query is easier to read than "http://{domain}/{page}{query} simply because of the whitespace
comprehension_debugging: No I don't think it has much of an affect on my ability to quickly understand or debug code snippets.
preference_rationale: I personally prefer string concatenation because I find it easier to read, but maybe for some cases string interpolation might be a good idea because it does slim down the text a bit. String concatenation does tend to get a little bit hard to read the longer the text becomes.
learning_curve: I honestly forgot what string interpolation was until I was mostly done with the questions, and then it clicked. I used string interpolation a few times when I first started programming, but now I mostly use concatenation.
suggestions_improvement: I don't know if the syntax itself could really be changed, but I think something as simple as syntax highlighting can make a big difference in aiding readability and comprehension.
